pageContext.claim: “In some cases, if they're good enough, we'll renovate it because we can do it for a lot less money. But generally, some of these walls are worthless. I mean, literally, you just drive right over them. They're laying down on their side. They gave me no credit. But if you read the story, they'll say, "While he has renovated a lot of wall…" Well, that's not even a renovation, let's face it. That's a brand new wall. It's all brand new wall. It just shows you how dishonest this fake news is.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump appears to be responding our fact checks on the wall with this tweet. Congress had made it clear that the money cannot be spent on the concrete wall that Trump promised during the campaign; the money for the barriers could be used only for items listed as “primary pedestrian levee fencing,” “primary pedestrian fencing” and “secondary fencing.” He tries to suggest that a concrete levee, with bollard fencing, is the same thing. But it is not.
